extracted_news.body: The article discusses the need to radicalize the fight against surveillance and censorship, particularly in light of recent developments such as the passing of the "Global Security" law in France. It emphasizes the importance of protecting fundamental human rights and freedom of expression, and highlights the role of technology in providing tools for secure communication and information dissemination. The article calls for action and vigilance in the face of increasing threats to our rights.

detailed_analysis.title: FRAX Integrates with Ethereum Layer 2 Network Scroll
detailed_analysis.body: FRAX now integrated with Ethereum Layer 2 network Scroll. According to BlockBeats, on April 26, according to official news, FRAX has been integrated with the Ethereum Layer 2 network Scroll. Users can redeem FRAX assets on SushiSwap on Scroll. This integration is achieved through Axelar Network.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance to Allocate $250 Million to USDEFRAX POL, Aiming for Deep USD Liquidity
detailed_analysis.body: Ethena Labs announced on a social platform that Frax Finance's Singularity Roadmap proposal has been approved, which includes allocating funds for USDEFRAX POL through Curve AMO, capped at $250 million. This move aims to create one of the deepest USD liquidity pools on the chain and diversify Frax's revenue sources.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Allocates $250M of EthEna Labs’ USDE to New Liquidity Pool
detailed_analysis.body: Decentralized finance (DeFi) lending protocol Frax Finance has recently passed a community governance proposal that greenlighted a $250 million allocation of EthEna Labs’ USDE to a new liquidity pool. As part of Frax’s Singularity Roadmap, the proposal enables the creation of an Automated Market Operation (AMO) that will allow the minting of new Frax tokens backed by overcollateralized debt. The proposal was approved on April 5. The proposal will create one of the deepest liquidity pools in the DeFi space, while enabling Frax to diversify its backing yield, according to EthEna Labs, which wrote in an April 8 X post: “As of yesterday, Frax has begun adding USDE POL which will create one of the deepest pools of dollar liquidity on-chain, and enable Frax to diversify their source of backing yield.” The new Curve-based liquidity pool held $44.9 million worth of liquidity as of 10:45 AM UTC, with $30.6 million worth of Frax coins and $14.6 million worth of the USDE synthetic dollar, according to Curve Finance data. EthEna Labs surpassed the $2 billion mark in total value locked (TVL) on April 6, in less than two months since USDE was launched on the mainnet on Feb. 19, according to DeFiLlama data. The protocol is currently offering a 37.1% annual percentage yield (APY) on USDE to over 125,300 investors, according to its homepage. EthEna Labs made headlines last week after it announced adding Bitcoin backing to its USDE synthetic dollar in an effort to further scale from its current $2 billion supply. EthEna Labs became the highest-earning decentralized application (DApp) in crypto on March 8 when it offered a 67% APY on USDE, prompting widespread community concerns about the protocol’s financial sustainability. Following its success, EthEna also caught the attention of large investment funds, becoming the highest-conviction bet for Delphi Ventures for the current cycle. USDE could become the largest dollar-backed asset after Tether’s USDT and Circle’s USDC, according to José Maria Macedo, the CEO of Delphi Labs and the founding partner of crypto investment firm Delphi Ventures, who wrote in an April 2 post: “SUSDE will offer the highest dollar yield in crypto at scale. USDE will become the largest stablecoin outside of USDC/USDT in 2024. EthEna will become the highest revenue-generating project in all of crypto.”

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Expands to Cosmos Ecosystem Through Noble
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance expands to the Cosmos ecosystem through asset issuance chain Noble. The Frax token (FRAX), a crypto-collateralized stablecoin pegged to the U.S. dollar, and its staked version, sFRAX, will become native to the Cosmos ecosystem via Noble.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Partners with Noble to Introduce Frax Stablecoin to Cosmos Ecosystem
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance partners with Noble to introduce the Frax stablecoin to the Cosmos ecosystem. The initial offering on Noble will include Frax tokens, a decentralized stablecoin that combines collateral and algorithmic mechanisms for stability, and sFrax, a staking version of Frax designed to provide returns.

detailed_analysis.title: Noble Partners with Frax Finance to Introduce FRAX and sFRAX Stablecoins to Cosmos Ecosystem
detailed_analysis.body: Noble has partnered with Frax Finance to bring decentralized stablecoins FRAX and sFRAX into the Cosmos and IBC ecosystems. Other Frax Finance tokens, such as the Frax Price Index (FPI) and FraxEther (FRXETH), are expected to be available later. FRAX is a USD pegged stablecoin with a 100% collateralization ratio, using algorithmic market operations (AMO) contracts and non-custodial subprotocols to maintain its dollar peg. sFRAX is a staked version of FRAX, offering yield exposure for users. Frax is the eighth largest stablecoin by market cap, with a current market cap of $388.2 million. The partnership aims to enhance liquidity, interoperability, and user experience within the Cosmos ecosystem, with Noble facilitating access to FRAX and sFRAX across major Cosmos chains integrated with IBC.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance's Singularity Roadmap Proposal Part One Approved
detailed_analysis.body: The first part of the Frax Finance Singularity Roadmap proposal has been approved. Key updates include the start of revenue sharing for veFXS holders and FXS buybacks through the Fraxtal liquidity engine. The cap rate on sFRAX will increase to 50% APY, with a floor rate of 5.40%. Frax is collaborating with Ethana to allocate 250 million FRAX to the sUSD lending pool in the lending protocol Morpho, and POL in Fraxlend and Curve to enhance Frax's cash flow and sFRAX APY. In the coming weeks, sFRXETH will be supported by EigenLayer AVS validators through a strategic partnership, offering holders points and additional earnings. The second snapshot date for FXTL points has been moved to April 18 at 07:59 to allow more community participation in staking veFXS on Fraxtal.

detailed_analysis.title: FRAX Tokens to be Natively Issued on Noble, Expanding into Cosmos Ecosystem
detailed_analysis.body: FRAX Finance is collaborating with Noble to expand FRAX’s products into the Cosmos ecosystem, providing a relatively decentralized alternative to USDC. The collaboration allows FRAX and sFRAX tokens to be integrated natively across the Cosmos ecosystem — made up of over 80 interconnected blockchains — for various applications, including decentralized finance and payments. This is in addition to its current issuance on Ethereum, where it has a total value locked of over $1.1 billion. FRAX’s initial offerings on Noble will include the FRAX token, a decentralized stablecoin that combines collateralized and algorithmic mechanisms for peg stability, and sFRAX, a staked version of FRAX that aims to provide a yield. Within the Cosmos ecosystem, Noble is known for being the native asset issuance network for Circle’s USDC stablecoin, from which it can move to other Cosmos chains like Osmosis, Celestia, Sei, Injective, and Neutron. There is over $200 million of native USDC currently outstanding following its launch in September 2023. This is not the first instance of an Ethereum-based project extending its reach into the Cosmos ecosystem. Previous integrations include Lido’s staked ether (STETH) tokens and the DAI stablecoin. However, these were introduced to Cosmos as bridged versions, rather than native ones.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Opens Community Voting for Singularity Roadmap Proposal
detailed_analysis.body: The first part of the Frax Finance Singularity Roadmap proposal has opened for community voting on March 26, with the voting deadline set for March 31 at 8:17. This part of the proposal includes the launch of Fraxtal; the release of all Frax assets including FRAX, sFRAX, FRXETH, as well as new Frax assets on Fraxtal first; the launch of 23 L3s over the next year to establish the Fraxtal Nation community; and the introduction of the new FXS Magic Point token economics.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Unveils Roadmap with Plans for 23 L3 Launches and $100 Billion TVL Goal
detailed_analysis.body: On March 22, Frax Finance founder Sam Kazemian unveiled the future roadmap for Frax at the Governance Forum. The roadmap includes ambitious plans to achieve a Fraxtal TVL (Total Value Locked) of over $100 billion by the end of 2026. A significant part of this strategy involves launching 23 official L3s to initiate the Fraxtal Nation community. These L3 chains will not only be able to earn FXTL points through Flox but will also have reserved slots for official partners, who will receive additional support from Fraxtal core developers and large allocations of FXTL. Furthermore, Frax plans to introduce new assets such as FRXNEAR, FRXTIA, and FRXMETIS this year. Kazemian also proposed financial strategies including reopening the protocol fee switch, with 50% of proceeds going to VEFXS and the other 50% used for repurchasing FXS and other Frax assets. Additionally, a reduction in the conversion rate from FPIS to VEFXS by 67%, setting a new rate of 1 FPIS to 1.33 VEFXS with a four-year lock-up period, was proposed.

detailed_analysis.title: FRAX Finance Aims for $100B TVL with Singularity Roadmap
detailed_analysis.body: FRAX Finance has announced its Singularity Roadmap, aiming for a $100 billion Total Value Locked (TVL) in its Layer 2 Fraxtal.

detailed_analysis.title: FRAX Finance Community Proposes Reactivation of Fee Switch
detailed_analysis.body: FRAX Finance community proposes to reactivate the fee switch. According to a message from BlockBeats on March 12th, as shown on the community governance forum, Westwood proposed to reactivate the fee switch on the FRAX Finance forum. The proposal stated that the collateralization ratio (CR) of FRAX was 98.8%, close to 100%, and the overall market sentiment was bullish. Therefore, it was suggested to resume the distribution of fees to veFXS holders. Prior to the protocol obtaining external collateral, fees should be distributed to veFXS holders and the protocol treasury in a ratio of 75/25.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance to Announce Revenue Distribution Plan for veFXS Token Holders
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance plans to announce its proposed revenue distribution plan within 10 days. According to a BlockBeats report on February 27th, Sam Kazemian, the founder of the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance, stated that they are considering resuming the distribution of rewards to token stakers within the next two weeks. "Yes, they previously voted to stop income distribution. But now we think it's an appropriate time to open up a huge switch. This will bring in a lot of revenue," Kazemian said, adding that the implementation will be completed within 10 days. As reported yesterday by BlockBeats, Frax Finance's core team is considering proposing a new plan aimed at sharing protocol revenue with its veFXS token holders. This move will mimic a similar proposal on decentralized exchange Uniswap last week.

detailed_analysis.title: FXS Price Surges Over 10% Following Frax Finance's Revenue Sharing Plan Announcement
detailed_analysis.body: Affected by the news of "Frax Finance plans to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders", FXS surged more than 10% in the short term. According to market data from OKX on February 26th, as reported by BlockBeats, FXS surged over 11% in a short period of time to a current price of $9.3 USD due to the news that Frax Finance plans to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Considers Revenue Sharing Proposal for veFXS Token Holders
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance is considering a new proposal to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders, similar to a recent proposal on Uniswap. CEO Sam Kazemian revealed that this proposal aims to share a portion of the protocol's revenue with veFXS token holders, who are users that lock FXS tokens to receive veFXS, retaining governance and utility rights. These tokens can be staked on the Ethereum mainnet and Frax Finance's layer-2 network, Fraxtal. Despite the community voting to stop revenue sharing in 2022, Kazemian stated they are exploring the possibility of reopening revenue distribution to veFXS holders.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Considers Revenue Sharing with FXS Stakers, FXS Price Jumps 17%
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance's core team is considering a proposal to share protocol revenue with stakers of the FXS token, following a model similar to Uniswap's. This news has led to a 17% increase in the price of FXS. The proposal, still pending community approval, aims to distribute a portion of Frax Finance's growing annual revenues back to FXS stakers. The initiative mirrors a recent successful proposal by Uniswap that boosted UNI token prices by over 70%.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Considers Uniswap-Like Reward Mechanism for Token Stakers
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance is considering implementing a reward mechanism similar to Uniswap for its token stakers. The decision to adopt this mechanism will be left to the community's vote, as stated by Frax's CEO, Sam Kazemian, in an interview with CoinDesk.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Launches Ethereum Layer 2 Network Fraxtal
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance, a leading DeFi project, has announced the launch of its Ethereum Layer 2 network, Fraxtal. The network, which is an Ethereum compatible optimistic rollup developed using OP Stack, has become operational today on a restricted mainnet for select partner applications. Fraxtal is part of the Optimism's Superchain ecosystem alongside Coinbase-backed Base, with initial access limited to launch partners including Safe, Chainlink Oracles, and decentralized infrastructure providers such as Axelar and LayerZero bridges. It is anticipated that general users will soon gain access to the chain, which will serve as a platform for decentralized applications (DApps), focusing on decentralized finance. Frax, valued at over $1 billion, operates under the management of Frax Shares (FXS) tokens. An airdrop snapshot for holders of the voted FXS tokens will be available on March 6, offering Fraxtal (FXTL) points, though it's unclear if these points will be replaced with a separate token in the future.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Launches Modular Layer 2 Blockchain Fraxtal
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance has announced the launch of a modular Layer 2 blockchain called Fraxtal. BlockBeats news, on February 8th, the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance officially announced the launch of its modular Layer 2 blockchain Fraxtal. Fraxtal testnet and mainnet are now open to specific launch partners, and ordinary users will be able to connect to the chain in the coming days.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax V3 Introduces Frax Bond Module with Trustless Debt Repayment
detailed_analysis.body: Frax V3 has officially launched the Frax Bond (FXB) module. The development team has completed the design and deployment of all new functions for Frax V3. The FXB is uniquely priced in Frax stablecoin rather than USD, allowing for trustless debt repayment through FXB contracts. The initial release includes three FXBs with maturity dates set for June 30th, 2024, December 31st, 2024, and December 31st, 2026.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance to Launch Layer 2 Blockchain Fraxtal in February
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance, a stablecoin protocol, has announced plans to launch its Layer 2 blockchain, Fraxtal, in February. The founder, Sam Kazemian, revealed that the launch is scheduled for the first week of February, with Etherscan providing support for Fraxscan from day one. A significant number of projects are expected to debut following the release. Fraxtal aims to enhance Frax's product suite, which includes a fully collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, a lending platform, an automated market maker, an inflation-linked stablecoin (FPI), and the liquidity provider token FRXETH. The new blockchain will utilize rollup technology to execute transactions on the Ethereum mainnet, offering batch processing and data compression. FRXETH will serve as the power source for Layer 2 and will be used to pay gas fees on the blockchain.

detailed_analysis.title: Integration of Frax Finance with Axelar (AXL) and Centrifuge's RWA has been completed.
detailed_analysis.body:
BlockBeats reported on December 22nd that the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance has completed integration with off-chain asset tokenization pioneer Centrifuge through cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL). The Frax community voted to establish a $20 million debt ceiling for Anemoy LTF, which is a US financial fund registered on Centrifuge and regulated by the British Virgin Islands (BVI). 

Axelar (AXL) allows any on-chain protocol and liquidity to interoperate with Centrifuge's RWA (Real World Asset) issuance. Frax has approved Axelar as the cross-chain infrastructure, safely expanding Frax beyond its native bridge Frax Ferry. The "Centrifuge Everywhere" multi-chain strategy is supported by Axelar, bringing native Centrifuge RWA to Arbitrum, Base, Celo, and Ethereum.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance integrates cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL) and issues assets such
detailed_analysis.body:
BlockBeats news, on December 20th, Frax Finance, a hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol, announced that it has integrated with cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL) to issue assets such as FRAX and frxETH on multiple blockchain platforms including Osmosis, Mantle, Linea, Kujira, Manta Network, and Scroll. This move aims to enhance the coverage and interoperability of its assets, further expanding the ecosystem of Frax Finance.

Frax Finance recently launched an extensive real-world asset (RWA) strategy, with cross-chain expansion being a core part of it. Blockchain interoperability is seen as a key factor in the practicality of stablecoin and RWA applications. Frax chose Axelar Network as a partner based on its scalability, programmability, and security. Through this partnership, Frax aims to promote the generation, trading, and circulation of digital assets in multiple use cases, contributing to the development of a more interconnected decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax founder: FXS will be the gas token of Fraxchain, which can share network sorter revenue.
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on November 2nd that Sam Kazemian, founder of Frax Finance, announced on the official Telegram channel that Fraxchain will be a general-purpose Rollup instead of an application chain designed specifically for Frax Finance. Any type of application can be deployed on Fraxchain. FXS will be the gas token for Fraxchain, which can share network sorter revenue and be used for decentralized mechanism regulation of the sorter after future updates.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Reports Domain Hijacking Incident
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance confirms the successful resolution of its domain name hijacking issue. There have been no instances of user funds being compromised.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance: The domain has been restored to normal and the reason for the incident will be announced
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on November 1st that Frax Finance announced on social media that Name.com has contacted and confirmed that frax.finance and frax.com domain names have been restored to the correct domain servers and configurations. They will explain the cause of the incident after conducting a comprehensive investigation tomorrow.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance DNS domain name was taken over by hackers.
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance DNS domain name was taken over by hackers. This is the third recent security incident in which a domain name has been taken over through social engineering. Frax Finance and its founder Sam Kazemian said users should not use the domain name until they get it back.…

detailed_analysis.title: PardShield: Frax Finance website DNS appears to have been hijacked.
detailed_analysis.body: According to PeckShield's monitoring data on November 1st, the DNS of the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance's website was suspected to have been hijacked. As previously reported by BlockBeats, Frax Finance officials have advised against using the frax.finance and frax.com domains until further notice.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance: Please refrain from using the frax.finance and frax.com domains until further notice.
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on November 1st that Frax Finance, a hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol, has officially stated that users should not use the domains frax.finance and frax.com until further notice. If any users know employees of the domain service provider Name.com, please contact Frax Finance.

Users can earn boosted yields by supplying MAI and FRAX into the liquidity pool and can also vote for the MAI/FRAX STABLE pool to receive weekly bribes in the form of $QI and $FXS.

detailed_analysis.body: The 24th issue of The Defiprime Post covers the biggest developments in Ethereum and DeFi from Jan. 3rd to Jan. 10th, 2021. Highlights include new yield farming guides, DeFi hacks in 2020, and the launch of the new COVER token. Other topics covered include vulnerabilities in DeFi Saver and the release of Wrapped Monero on the Ethereum blockchain. The article also discusses updates from Yearn, Alpha Homora, Agaave, Yam Finance, and more. detailed_analysis.title: Primitive 2021
Announcing Muun 2.0
detailed_analysis.body: Muun 2.0, a mobile wallet for bitcoin and lightning, aims to make self-custody easy and safe for every bitcoin user. It comes at a crucial time as bitcoin crosses the chasm between early adopters and mainstream users. The focus is on maintaining self-custodianship even as bitcoin becomes more complex and fees increase. Muun 2.0 is a complete rethinking of the wallet based on user feedback and promises an improved user experience.

Kusama also had treasury proposals approved and reached its goal of 780 validators. Ethereum compatibility with Substrate and Polkadot was discussed, and tools like the Polkadot JS browser extension and Polkadot JS Apps were updated. The newsletter also highlighted upcoming events and webinars, and encouraged voting in the governance process.

detailed_analysis.title: Introducing the Umbrel App Store
detailed_analysis.body: Introducing the Umbrel App Store: A new era of self-hosted Bitcoin apps begins. Users can now run their own payment processor, set up multi-signature custody, run a blockchain explorer, chat over the Lightning Network, and more, all backed by their own Bitcoin and Lightning node. The Umbrel App Store offers one-click installation and a Tor hidden service for each app, ensuring privacy and security. Developers can also build and submit apps using the Umbrel App Framework. This marks a paradigm shift in computing and empowers users to take control of their data and transactions.

The newsletter concludes with fresh content recommendations and a farewell from the DeFi Arts Intelligencer team.

detailed_analysis.title: Filecoin Ecosystem Growth & Innovation
detailed_analysis.body: Key takeaways from the Storage Market Summit featuring Filecoin and ETH Global on Dec. 11.

detailed_analysis.title: Meet the Filecoin Foundation
detailed_analysis.body: Introducing Filecoin Foundation: Driving network growth and development.

detailed_analysis.title: Filecoin Dev Grants Waves 4-5 and Gitcoin Grants
detailed_analysis.body: Filecoin announces new dev grants and participation in Gitcoin Grants Round 8 with focus on miner tooling and Apollo Filecoin Dapps. Apply by Jan 15th for priority consideration.

detailed_analysis.title: Filecoin Network Economics
detailed_analysis.body: Key takeaways from the Storage Market Summit featuring Filecoin and ETH Global on Dec. 11.

detailed_analysis.title: The Defiprime Post #22
detailed_analysis.body: This issue of The Defiprime Post covers the listing of Aave, Bancor, and Synthetix on Coinbase, the launch of ether futures by CME Group, the growth of DeFi and its regulatory challenges, the introduction of Compound Chain, the launch of a community governance system by Tornado.Cash, and other developments in the DeFi space. It also includes updates on MetaMask, Graph Protocol, Euler, Unlock Protocol, Lido, and more. Additionally, it highlights the funding rounds of Bonfida, MATH, and Union, as well as the collaboration between DeversiFi and Loopring to improve layer-two scaling solutions. The report also mentions the popularity of stablecoin-centric yield farms and the introduction of permissionless timed auctions by SuperRare.

detailed_analysis.title: The Machine That Made the Vaccine: Company, Platform, Innovation
detailed_analysis.body: Moderna CEO reveals the story behind the vaccine's development and the technology that made it possible.

detailed_analysis.title: Ethereum.org Translation Program: Milestones and Updates
detailed_analysis.body: Exciting updates for Ethereum.org's Translation Program and milestones to celebrate. Gratitude for the support received this year.

detailed_analysis.title: DeFi Arts Intelligencer - Dec. 19th, 2020
detailed_analysis.body: "The DeFi Arts Intelligencer is rebranding to Metaversal, becoming a sub-newsletter of Bankless. The publication will continue to provide curated NFT news, expanding its reach to a wider audience."

detailed_analysis.title: Introducing Bitcoin Zero [BTC0]
detailed_analysis.body: Bitcoin Zero (BTC0) is a new ERC-20 token that delivers Bitcoin with net-zero emissions. It combines a single Bitcoin with the retirement of 10 tonnes of CO2 from certified rainforest projects. BTC0 is available for trading on Uphold and aims to stimulate demand for voluntary carbon credits while allowing users to own Bitcoin. This breakthrough was made possible by the availability of Universal Carbon (UPCO2), the world's first tradable carbon token. BTC0 is part of the Universal Protocol Alliance's suite of stablecoin and crypto-commodity tokens.

detailed_analysis.title: Mina Launches Adversarial Testnet in Lead-Up to Mainnet Launch to Ensure Network Strength and…
detailed_analysis.body: Mina launches adversarial testnet "Testworld" to ensure network security and resilience before mainnet launch. Participants can earn token rewards and qualify for Genesis grants. Mina's unique use of recursive zk-SNARKs keeps the blockchain lightweight and accessible.

detailed_analysis.title: Aave Protocol Governance V2 has been activated!
detailed_analysis.body: Aave Protocol V2 has launched, with a market size of over $98M. The release of V2 governance allows community members to create and vote on proposals, delegate proposal power, and upgrade voting strategies. The governance also includes multiple executors for security and a guardian to prevent governance attacks. This step towards decentralization puts the protocol in the hands of the community.

detailed_analysis.title: Filecoin Collaborative Resource and Risk Management
detailed_analysis.body: Key takeaways from the Storage Market Summit featuring Filecoin and ETH Global on Dec. 11.

detailed_analysis.title: The PPP Omnibus: Eminent Domain, Fraud, and Fintech
detailed_analysis.body: Exploring the Paycheck Protection Program and its impact on small businesses, government stimulus, and the role of technology.

detailed_analysis.title: TALKS AT PBWS & IPFS WRAP UP 2020
detailed_analysis.body: Berty participated in two important events, the Paris Blockchain Week Summit and the Wrap Up 2020 organized by IPFS. They discussed decentralization, Web3, IPFS, and privacy. Berty highlighted their advances in 2020, including the release of the Berty Protocol and going 100% open-source. Their goals for 2021 include the public release of Berty, enhancing gomobile-ipfs, and improving stability and performance of IPFS on mobile. They expressed gratitude to their supporters and reflected on the challenges and progress of the past year. Exciting surprises are expected in 2021.

While #eth2 has been on our minds, incredible progress has been made in recent months by all EF-supported teams. We might’ve missed quite a bit from each other while apart this year, so we’re excited to share a *long* report detailing their updates today.

detailed_analysis.title: (Re)Introducing Colony
Translate Berty!
detailed_analysis.body: Help us translate the Berty app & website using Crowdin. Spread our message to non-English speakers and make knowledge accessible to all. No coding skills required. Use Crowdin's visual interface to translate strings and ensure accurate and up-to-date translations. Join us in this important mission and contribute to fighting censorship and surveillance.

detailed_analysis.title: Dot Leap 26
detailed_analysis.body: Introducing NFT Review, a newsletter focusing on the NFT evolution in the Polkadot ecosystem. Also, updates on governance proposals, treasury funding, and Ethereum compatibility.

detailed_analysis.title: The Defiprime Post #20
detailed_analysis.body: The 20th issue of The Defiprime Post covers the latest developments in Ethereum and DeFi, including the launch of Aave's improved V2 protocol, Coinbase and Binance introducing ETH2 derivatives, and S&P Dow Jones Indices planning to launch cryptocurrency-based indexes. Other topics include Maker vetting new collateral types, Fireblocks expanding its DeFi service, and Andre Cronje explaining Yearn's recent partnerships. The DEX Report highlights Yearn's collaboration with SushiSwap, the launch of the Peanut project, and 1inch.exchange's funding round. The State of the Stablecoins section discusses Basis Cash, the proposed STABLE Act, and Binance listing Synthetix's sUSD. The NFT News section features a talk by cryptoartists Pak and Signe Pierce.

detailed_analysis.title: We are sunsetting Studio
detailed_analysis.body: Ethereum Studio is shutting down soon. Download your projects now. Use Remix for Solidity development.

detailed_analysis.title: DeFi Arts Intelligencer - Dec. 5th, 2020
detailed_analysis.body: The 46th issue of the DeFi Arts Intelligencer highlights the booming NFT sports arena, particularly the success of F1 Delta Time. The newsletter also discusses the release of digital art and collectibles on platforms like SuperRare, the launch of Aave's V2 system, and partnerships involving Yearn. Additionally, it mentions the milestone of over 1 million ETH staked in the Eth2 deposit contract. The newsletter is curated by William M. Peaster, an Ethereum and DeFi enthusiast.

detailed_analysis.title: Huobi Group Launches Filecoin Incubation Center
detailed_analysis.body: Huobi and Protocol labs join forces to establish Huobi Filecoin Incubation Center, backed by a $10M fund.

detailed_analysis.title: YFI Holders Have Strong Hands and Bought the Dip
detailed_analysis.body: Yearn Finance has recently "merged" with six different DeFi protocols, including Pickle, Cream, PowerPool, Cover, Akropolis, and SushiSwap. These mergers, partnerships, and collaborations aim to expand Yearn into a DeFi ecosystem with a strong developer community across multiple verticals. The on-chain activity of YFI holders has shown bullish trends, with an increase in the number of YFI holders, buying at lower prices, and YFI leaving centralized and decentralized exchanges. This progress reflects Yearn's rapid development and innovation.

detailed_analysis.title: 📬 DeFiprime #27 - November's Recap
detailed_analysis.body: New DeFi products and developments include PieDAO's DEFI++ index token, 1inch.exchange's v2 with optimizations, sOIL token representing Brent Crude Futures, StaFi's Eth2 staking liquidity solution, Vector's cross-chain routing network, Umbrella Protocol for risk management, Slingshot's DEX aggregator, and CRETH2 Eth2 derivatives token. Defiprime also lists new products and features interviews with DeFi projects. Noteworthy links include collaborations, investments, and announcements in the decentralized space. Stay updated by subscribing to Defiprime's new Twitter account.

detailed_analysis.title: Watching 👁️ ‘Global Security’ & Surveillance in France
detailed_analysis.body: The article discusses the need to radicalize the fight against surveillance and censorship, particularly in light of recent developments such as the passing of the "Global Security" law in France. It emphasizes the importance of protecting fundamental human rights and freedom of expression, and highlights the role of technology in providing tools for secure communication and information dissemination. The article calls for action and vigilance in the face of increasing threats to our rights.

extracted_news.title: FRAX Integrates with Ethereum Layer 2 Network Scroll
extracted_news.body: FRAX now integrated with Ethereum Layer 2 network Scroll. According to BlockBeats, on April 26, according to official news, FRAX has been integrated with the Ethereum Layer 2 network Scroll. Users can redeem FRAX assets on SushiSwap on Scroll. This integration is achieved through Axelar Network.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance to Allocate $250 Million to USDEFRAX POL, Aiming for Deep USD Liquidity
extracted_news.body: Ethena Labs announced on a social platform that Frax Finance's Singularity Roadmap proposal has been approved, which includes allocating funds for USDEFRAX POL through Curve AMO, capped at $250 million. This move aims to create one of the deepest USD liquidity pools on the chain and diversify Frax's revenue sources.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Allocates $250M of EthEna Labs’ USDE to New Liquidity Pool
extracted_news.body: Decentralized finance (DeFi) lending protocol Frax Finance has recently passed a community governance proposal that greenlighted a $250 million allocation of EthEna Labs’ USDE to a new liquidity pool. As part of Frax’s Singularity Roadmap, the proposal enables the creation of an Automated Market Operation (AMO) that will allow the minting of new Frax tokens backed by overcollateralized debt. The proposal was approved on April 5. The proposal will create one of the deepest liquidity pools in the DeFi space, while enabling Frax to diversify its backing yield, according to EthEna Labs, which wrote in an April 8 X post: “As of yesterday, Frax has begun adding USDE POL which will create one of the deepest pools of dollar liquidity on-chain, and enable Frax to diversify their source of backing yield.” The new Curve-based liquidity pool held $44.9 million worth of liquidity as of 10:45 AM UTC, with $30.6 million worth of Frax coins and $14.6 million worth of the USDE synthetic dollar, according to Curve Finance data. EthEna Labs surpassed the $2 billion mark in total value locked (TVL) on April 6, in less than two months since USDE was launched on the mainnet on Feb. 19, according to DeFiLlama data. The protocol is currently offering a 37.1% annual percentage yield (APY) on USDE to over 125,300 investors, according to its homepage. EthEna Labs made headlines last week after it announced adding Bitcoin backing to its USDE synthetic dollar in an effort to further scale from its current $2 billion supply. EthEna Labs became the highest-earning decentralized application (DApp) in crypto on March 8 when it offered a 67% APY on USDE, prompting widespread community concerns about the protocol’s financial sustainability. Following its success, EthEna also caught the attention of large investment funds, becoming the highest-conviction bet for Delphi Ventures for the current cycle. USDE could become the largest dollar-backed asset after Tether’s USDT and Circle’s USDC, according to José Maria Macedo, the CEO of Delphi Labs and the founding partner of crypto investment firm Delphi Ventures, who wrote in an April 2 post: “SUSDE will offer the highest dollar yield in crypto at scale. USDE will become the largest stablecoin outside of USDC/USDT in 2024. EthEna will become the highest revenue-generating project in all of crypto.”

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Expands to Cosmos Ecosystem Through Noble
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance expands to the Cosmos ecosystem through asset issuance chain Noble. The Frax token (FRAX), a crypto-collateralized stablecoin pegged to the U.S. dollar, and its staked version, sFRAX, will become native to the Cosmos ecosystem via Noble.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Partners with Noble to Introduce Frax Stablecoin to Cosmos Ecosystem
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance partners with Noble to introduce the Frax stablecoin to the Cosmos ecosystem. The initial offering on Noble will include Frax tokens, a decentralized stablecoin that combines collateral and algorithmic mechanisms for stability, and sFrax, a staking version of Frax designed to provide returns.

extracted_news.title: Noble Partners with Frax Finance to Introduce FRAX and sFRAX Stablecoins to Cosmos Ecosystem
extracted_news.body: Noble has partnered with Frax Finance to bring decentralized stablecoins FRAX and sFRAX into the Cosmos and IBC ecosystems. Other Frax Finance tokens, such as the Frax Price Index (FPI) and FraxEther (FRXETH), are expected to be available later. FRAX is a USD pegged stablecoin with a 100% collateralization ratio, using algorithmic market operations (AMO) contracts and non-custodial subprotocols to maintain its dollar peg. sFRAX is a staked version of FRAX, offering yield exposure for users. Frax is the eighth largest stablecoin by market cap, with a current market cap of $388.2 million. The partnership aims to enhance liquidity, interoperability, and user experience within the Cosmos ecosystem, with Noble facilitating access to FRAX and sFRAX across major Cosmos chains integrated with IBC.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance's Singularity Roadmap Proposal Part One Approved
extracted_news.body: The first part of the Frax Finance Singularity Roadmap proposal has been approved. Key updates include the start of revenue sharing for veFXS holders and FXS buybacks through the Fraxtal liquidity engine. The cap rate on sFRAX will increase to 50% APY, with a floor rate of 5.40%. Frax is collaborating with Ethana to allocate 250 million FRAX to the sUSD lending pool in the lending protocol Morpho, and POL in Fraxlend and Curve to enhance Frax's cash flow and sFRAX APY. In the coming weeks, sFRXETH will be supported by EigenLayer AVS validators through a strategic partnership, offering holders points and additional earnings. The second snapshot date for FXTL points has been moved to April 18 at 07:59 to allow more community participation in staking veFXS on Fraxtal.

extracted_news.title: FRAX Tokens to be Natively Issued on Noble, Expanding into Cosmos Ecosystem
extracted_news.body: FRAX Finance is collaborating with Noble to expand FRAX’s products into the Cosmos ecosystem, providing a relatively decentralized alternative to USDC. The collaboration allows FRAX and sFRAX tokens to be integrated natively across the Cosmos ecosystem — made up of over 80 interconnected blockchains — for various applications, including decentralized finance and payments. This is in addition to its current issuance on Ethereum, where it has a total value locked of over $1.1 billion. FRAX’s initial offerings on Noble will include the FRAX token, a decentralized stablecoin that combines collateralized and algorithmic mechanisms for peg stability, and sFRAX, a staked version of FRAX that aims to provide a yield. Within the Cosmos ecosystem, Noble is known for being the native asset issuance network for Circle’s USDC stablecoin, from which it can move to other Cosmos chains like Osmosis, Celestia, Sei, Injective, and Neutron. There is over $200 million of native USDC currently outstanding following its launch in September 2023. This is not the first instance of an Ethereum-based project extending its reach into the Cosmos ecosystem. Previous integrations include Lido’s staked ether (STETH) tokens and the DAI stablecoin. However, these were introduced to Cosmos as bridged versions, rather than native ones.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Opens Community Voting for Singularity Roadmap Proposal
extracted_news.body: The first part of the Frax Finance Singularity Roadmap proposal has opened for community voting on March 26, with the voting deadline set for March 31 at 8:17. This part of the proposal includes the launch of Fraxtal; the release of all Frax assets including FRAX, sFRAX, FRXETH, as well as new Frax assets on Fraxtal first; the launch of 23 L3s over the next year to establish the Fraxtal Nation community; and the introduction of the new FXS Magic Point token economics.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Unveils Roadmap with Plans for 23 L3 Launches and $100 Billion TVL Goal
extracted_news.body: On March 22, Frax Finance founder Sam Kazemian unveiled the future roadmap for Frax at the Governance Forum. The roadmap includes ambitious plans to achieve a Fraxtal TVL (Total Value Locked) of over $100 billion by the end of 2026. A significant part of this strategy involves launching 23 official L3s to initiate the Fraxtal Nation community. These L3 chains will not only be able to earn FXTL points through Flox but will also have reserved slots for official partners, who will receive additional support from Fraxtal core developers and large allocations of FXTL. Furthermore, Frax plans to introduce new assets such as FRXNEAR, FRXTIA, and FRXMETIS this year. Kazemian also proposed financial strategies including reopening the protocol fee switch, with 50% of proceeds going to VEFXS and the other 50% used for repurchasing FXS and other Frax assets. Additionally, a reduction in the conversion rate from FPIS to VEFXS by 67%, setting a new rate of 1 FPIS to 1.33 VEFXS with a four-year lock-up period, was proposed.

extracted_news.title: FRAX Finance Aims for $100B TVL with Singularity Roadmap
extracted_news.body: FRAX Finance has announced its Singularity Roadmap, aiming for a $100 billion Total Value Locked (TVL) in its Layer 2 Fraxtal.

extracted_news.title: FRAX Finance Community Proposes Reactivation of Fee Switch
extracted_news.body: FRAX Finance community proposes to reactivate the fee switch. According to a message from BlockBeats on March 12th, as shown on the community governance forum, Westwood proposed to reactivate the fee switch on the FRAX Finance forum. The proposal stated that the collateralization ratio (CR) of FRAX was 98.8%, close to 100%, and the overall market sentiment was bullish. Therefore, it was suggested to resume the distribution of fees to veFXS holders. Prior to the protocol obtaining external collateral, fees should be distributed to veFXS holders and the protocol treasury in a ratio of 75/25.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance to Announce Revenue Distribution Plan for veFXS Token Holders
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance plans to announce its proposed revenue distribution plan within 10 days. According to a BlockBeats report on February 27th, Sam Kazemian, the founder of the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance, stated that they are considering resuming the distribution of rewards to token stakers within the next two weeks. "Yes, they previously voted to stop income distribution. But now we think it's an appropriate time to open up a huge switch. This will bring in a lot of revenue," Kazemian said, adding that the implementation will be completed within 10 days. As reported yesterday by BlockBeats, Frax Finance's core team is considering proposing a new plan aimed at sharing protocol revenue with its veFXS token holders. This move will mimic a similar proposal on decentralized exchange Uniswap last week.

extracted_news.title: FXS Price Surges Over 10% Following Frax Finance's Revenue Sharing Plan Announcement
extracted_news.body: Affected by the news of "Frax Finance plans to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders", FXS surged more than 10% in the short term. According to market data from OKX on February 26th, as reported by BlockBeats, FXS surged over 11% in a short period of time to a current price of $9.3 USD due to the news that Frax Finance plans to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Considers Revenue Sharing Proposal for veFXS Token Holders
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance is considering a new proposal to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders, similar to a recent proposal on Uniswap. CEO Sam Kazemian revealed that this proposal aims to share a portion of the protocol's revenue with veFXS token holders, who are users that lock FXS tokens to receive veFXS, retaining governance and utility rights. These tokens can be staked on the Ethereum mainnet and Frax Finance's layer-2 network, Fraxtal. Despite the community voting to stop revenue sharing in 2022, Kazemian stated they are exploring the possibility of reopening revenue distribution to veFXS holders.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Considers Revenue Sharing with FXS Stakers, FXS Price Jumps 17%
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance's core team is considering a proposal to share protocol revenue with stakers of the FXS token, following a model similar to Uniswap's. This news has led to a 17% increase in the price of FXS. The proposal, still pending community approval, aims to distribute a portion of Frax Finance's growing annual revenues back to FXS stakers. The initiative mirrors a recent successful proposal by Uniswap that boosted UNI token prices by over 70%.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Considers Uniswap-Like Reward Mechanism for Token Stakers
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance is considering implementing a reward mechanism similar to Uniswap for its token stakers. The decision to adopt this mechanism will be left to the community's vote, as stated by Frax's CEO, Sam Kazemian, in an interview with CoinDesk.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Launches Ethereum Layer 2 Network Fraxtal
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance, a leading DeFi project, has announced the launch of its Ethereum Layer 2 network, Fraxtal. The network, which is an Ethereum compatible optimistic rollup developed using OP Stack, has become operational today on a restricted mainnet for select partner applications. Fraxtal is part of the Optimism's Superchain ecosystem alongside Coinbase-backed Base, with initial access limited to launch partners including Safe, Chainlink Oracles, and decentralized infrastructure providers such as Axelar and LayerZero bridges. It is anticipated that general users will soon gain access to the chain, which will serve as a platform for decentralized applications (DApps), focusing on decentralized finance. Frax, valued at over $1 billion, operates under the management of Frax Shares (FXS) tokens. An airdrop snapshot for holders of the voted FXS tokens will be available on March 6, offering Fraxtal (FXTL) points, though it's unclear if these points will be replaced with a separate token in the future.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance Launches Modular Layer 2 Blockchain Fraxtal
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance has announced the launch of a modular Layer 2 blockchain called Fraxtal. BlockBeats news, on February 8th, the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance officially announced the launch of its modular Layer 2 blockchain Fraxtal. Fraxtal testnet and mainnet are now open to specific launch partners, and ordinary users will be able to connect to the chain in the coming days.

extracted_news.title: Frax V3 Introduces Frax Bond Module with Trustless Debt Repayment
extracted_news.body: Frax V3 has officially launched the Frax Bond (FXB) module. The development team has completed the design and deployment of all new functions for Frax V3. The FXB is uniquely priced in Frax stablecoin rather than USD, allowing for trustless debt repayment through FXB contracts. The initial release includes three FXBs with maturity dates set for June 30th, 2024, December 31st, 2024, and December 31st, 2026.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance to Launch Layer 2 Blockchain Fraxtal in February
extracted_news.body: Frax Finance, a stablecoin protocol, has announced plans to launch its Layer 2 blockchain, Fraxtal, in February. The founder, Sam Kazemian, revealed that the launch is scheduled for the first week of February, with Etherscan providing support for Fraxscan from day one. A significant number of projects are expected to debut following the release. Fraxtal aims to enhance Frax's product suite, which includes a fully collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, a lending platform, an automated market maker, an inflation-linked stablecoin (FPI), and the liquidity provider token FRXETH. The new blockchain will utilize rollup technology to execute transactions on the Ethereum mainnet, offering batch processing and data compression. FRXETH will serve as the power source for Layer 2 and will be used to pay gas fees on the blockchain.

extracted_news.title: Integration of Frax Finance with Axelar (AXL) and Centrifuge's RWA has been completed.
extracted_news.body:
BlockBeats reported on December 22nd that the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance has completed integration with off-chain asset tokenization pioneer Centrifuge through cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL). The Frax community voted to establish a $20 million debt ceiling for Anemoy LTF, which is a US financial fund registered on Centrifuge and regulated by the British Virgin Islands (BVI). 

Axelar (AXL) allows any on-chain protocol and liquidity to interoperate with Centrifuge's RWA (Real World Asset) issuance. Frax has approved Axelar as the cross-chain infrastructure, safely expanding Frax beyond its native bridge Frax Ferry. The "Centrifuge Everywhere" multi-chain strategy is supported by Axelar, bringing native Centrifuge RWA to Arbitrum, Base, Celo, and Ethereum.

extracted_news.title: Frax Finance integrates cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL) and issues assets such
extracted_news.body:
BlockBeats news, on December 20th, Frax Finance, a hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol, announced that it has integrated with cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL) to issue assets such as FRAX and frxETH on multiple blockchain platforms including Osmosis, Mantle, Linea, Kujira, Manta Network, and Scroll. This move aims to enhance the coverage and interoperability of its assets, further expanding the ecosystem of Frax Finance.

Frax Finance recently launched an extensive real-world asset (RWA) strategy, with cross-chain expansion being a core part of it. Blockchain interoperability is seen as a key factor in the practicality of stablecoin and RWA applications. Frax chose Axelar Network as a partner based on its scalability, programmability, and security. Through this partnership, Frax aims to promote the generation, trading, and circulation of digital assets in multiple use cases, contributing to the development of a more interconnected decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem.

extracted_news.title: Introducing Bitcoin Zero [BTC0]
extracted_news.body: Bitcoin Zero (BTC0) is a new ERC-20 token that delivers Bitcoin with net-zero emissions. It combines a single Bitcoin with the retirement of 10 tonnes of CO2 from certified rainforest projects. BTC0 is available for trading on Uphold and aims to stimulate demand for voluntary carbon credits while allowing users to own Bitcoin. This breakthrough was made possible by the availability of Universal Carbon (UPCO2), the world's first tradable carbon token. BTC0 is part of the Universal Protocol Alliance's suite of stablecoin and crypto-commodity tokens.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance to Allocate $250 Million to USDEFRAX POL, Aiming for Deep USD Liquidity
detailed_analysis.body: Ethena Labs announced on a social platform that Frax Finance's Singularity Roadmap proposal has been approved, which includes allocating funds for USDEFRAX POL through Curve AMO, capped at $250 million. This move aims to create one of the deepest USD liquidity pools on the chain and diversify Frax's revenue sources.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Allocates $250M of EthEna Labs’ USDE to New Liquidity Pool
detailed_analysis.body: Decentralized finance (DeFi) lending protocol Frax Finance has recently passed a community governance proposal that greenlighted a $250 million allocation of EthEna Labs’ USDE to a new liquidity pool. As part of Frax’s Singularity Roadmap, the proposal enables the creation of an Automated Market Operation (AMO) that will allow the minting of new Frax tokens backed by overcollateralized debt. The proposal was approved on April 5. The proposal will create one of the deepest liquidity pools in the DeFi space, while enabling Frax to diversify its backing yield, according to EthEna Labs, which wrote in an April 8 X post: “As of yesterday, Frax has begun adding USDE POL which will create one of the deepest pools of dollar liquidity on-chain, and enable Frax to diversify their source of backing yield.” The new Curve-based liquidity pool held $44.9 million worth of liquidity as of 10:45 AM UTC, with $30.6 million worth of Frax coins and $14.6 million worth of the USDE synthetic dollar, according to Curve Finance data. EthEna Labs surpassed the $2 billion mark in total value locked (TVL) on April 6, in less than two months since USDE was launched on the mainnet on Feb. 19, according to DeFiLlama data. The protocol is currently offering a 37.1% annual percentage yield (APY) on USDE to over 125,300 investors, according to its homepage. EthEna Labs made headlines last week after it announced adding Bitcoin backing to its USDE synthetic dollar in an effort to further scale from its current $2 billion supply. EthEna Labs became the highest-earning decentralized application (DApp) in crypto on March 8 when it offered a 67% APY on USDE, prompting widespread community concerns about the protocol’s financial sustainability. Following its success, EthEna also caught the attention of large investment funds, becoming the highest-conviction bet for Delphi Ventures for the current cycle. USDE could become the largest dollar-backed asset after Tether’s USDT and Circle’s USDC, according to José Maria Macedo, the CEO of Delphi Labs and the founding partner of crypto investment firm Delphi Ventures, who wrote in an April 2 post: “SUSDE will offer the highest dollar yield in crypto at scale. USDE will become the largest stablecoin outside of USDC/USDT in 2024. EthEna will become the highest revenue-generating project in all of crypto.”

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Expands to Cosmos Ecosystem Through Noble
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance expands to the Cosmos ecosystem through asset issuance chain Noble. The Frax token (FRAX), a crypto-collateralized stablecoin pegged to the U.S. dollar, and its staked version, sFRAX, will become native to the Cosmos ecosystem via Noble.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Partners with Noble to Introduce Frax Stablecoin to Cosmos Ecosystem
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance partners with Noble to introduce the Frax stablecoin to the Cosmos ecosystem. The initial offering on Noble will include Frax tokens, a decentralized stablecoin that combines collateral and algorithmic mechanisms for stability, and sFrax, a staking version of Frax designed to provide returns.

detailed_analysis.title: Noble Partners with Frax Finance to Introduce FRAX and sFRAX Stablecoins to Cosmos Ecosystem
detailed_analysis.body: Noble has partnered with Frax Finance to bring decentralized stablecoins FRAX and sFRAX into the Cosmos and IBC ecosystems. Other Frax Finance tokens, such as the Frax Price Index (FPI) and FraxEther (FRXETH), are expected to be available later. FRAX is a USD pegged stablecoin with a 100% collateralization ratio, using algorithmic market operations (AMO) contracts and non-custodial subprotocols to maintain its dollar peg. sFRAX is a staked version of FRAX, offering yield exposure for users. Frax is the eighth largest stablecoin by market cap, with a current market cap of $388.2 million. The partnership aims to enhance liquidity, interoperability, and user experience within the Cosmos ecosystem, with Noble facilitating access to FRAX and sFRAX across major Cosmos chains integrated with IBC.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance's Singularity Roadmap Proposal Part One Approved
detailed_analysis.body: The first part of the Frax Finance Singularity Roadmap proposal has been approved. Key updates include the start of revenue sharing for veFXS holders and FXS buybacks through the Fraxtal liquidity engine. The cap rate on sFRAX will increase to 50% APY, with a floor rate of 5.40%. Frax is collaborating with Ethana to allocate 250 million FRAX to the sUSD lending pool in the lending protocol Morpho, and POL in Fraxlend and Curve to enhance Frax's cash flow and sFRAX APY. In the coming weeks, sFRXETH will be supported by EigenLayer AVS validators through a strategic partnership, offering holders points and additional earnings. The second snapshot date for FXTL points has been moved to April 18 at 07:59 to allow more community participation in staking veFXS on Fraxtal.

detailed_analysis.title: FRAX Tokens to be Natively Issued on Noble, Expanding into Cosmos Ecosystem
detailed_analysis.body: FRAX Finance is collaborating with Noble to expand FRAX’s products into the Cosmos ecosystem, providing a relatively decentralized alternative to USDC. The collaboration allows FRAX and sFRAX tokens to be integrated natively across the Cosmos ecosystem — made up of over 80 interconnected blockchains — for various applications, including decentralized finance and payments. This is in addition to its current issuance on Ethereum, where it has a total value locked of over $1.1 billion. FRAX’s initial offerings on Noble will include the FRAX token, a decentralized stablecoin that combines collateralized and algorithmic mechanisms for peg stability, and sFRAX, a staked version of FRAX that aims to provide a yield. Within the Cosmos ecosystem, Noble is known for being the native asset issuance network for Circle’s USDC stablecoin, from which it can move to other Cosmos chains like Osmosis, Celestia, Sei, Injective, and Neutron. There is over $200 million of native USDC currently outstanding following its launch in September 2023. This is not the first instance of an Ethereum-based project extending its reach into the Cosmos ecosystem. Previous integrations include Lido’s staked ether (STETH) tokens and the DAI stablecoin. However, these were introduced to Cosmos as bridged versions, rather than native ones.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Opens Community Voting for Singularity Roadmap Proposal
detailed_analysis.body: The first part of the Frax Finance Singularity Roadmap proposal has opened for community voting on March 26, with the voting deadline set for March 31 at 8:17. This part of the proposal includes the launch of Fraxtal; the release of all Frax assets including FRAX, sFRAX, FRXETH, as well as new Frax assets on Fraxtal first; the launch of 23 L3s over the next year to establish the Fraxtal Nation community; and the introduction of the new FXS Magic Point token economics.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Unveils Roadmap with Plans for 23 L3 Launches and $100 Billion TVL Goal
detailed_analysis.body: On March 22, Frax Finance founder Sam Kazemian unveiled the future roadmap for Frax at the Governance Forum. The roadmap includes ambitious plans to achieve a Fraxtal TVL (Total Value Locked) of over $100 billion by the end of 2026. A significant part of this strategy involves launching 23 official L3s to initiate the Fraxtal Nation community. These L3 chains will not only be able to earn FXTL points through Flox but will also have reserved slots for official partners, who will receive additional support from Fraxtal core developers and large allocations of FXTL. Furthermore, Frax plans to introduce new assets such as FRXNEAR, FRXTIA, and FRXMETIS this year. Kazemian also proposed financial strategies including reopening the protocol fee switch, with 50% of proceeds going to VEFXS and the other 50% used for repurchasing FXS and other Frax assets. Additionally, a reduction in the conversion rate from FPIS to VEFXS by 67%, setting a new rate of 1 FPIS to 1.33 VEFXS with a four-year lock-up period, was proposed.

detailed_analysis.title: FRAX Finance Aims for $100B TVL with Singularity Roadmap
detailed_analysis.body: FRAX Finance has announced its Singularity Roadmap, aiming for a $100 billion Total Value Locked (TVL) in its Layer 2 Fraxtal.

detailed_analysis.title: FRAX Finance Community Proposes Reactivation of Fee Switch
detailed_analysis.body: FRAX Finance community proposes to reactivate the fee switch. According to a message from BlockBeats on March 12th, as shown on the community governance forum, Westwood proposed to reactivate the fee switch on the FRAX Finance forum. The proposal stated that the collateralization ratio (CR) of FRAX was 98.8%, close to 100%, and the overall market sentiment was bullish. Therefore, it was suggested to resume the distribution of fees to veFXS holders. Prior to the protocol obtaining external collateral, fees should be distributed to veFXS holders and the protocol treasury in a ratio of 75/25.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance to Announce Revenue Distribution Plan for veFXS Token Holders
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance plans to announce its proposed revenue distribution plan within 10 days. According to a BlockBeats report on February 27th, Sam Kazemian, the founder of the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance, stated that they are considering resuming the distribution of rewards to token stakers within the next two weeks. "Yes, they previously voted to stop income distribution. But now we think it's an appropriate time to open up a huge switch. This will bring in a lot of revenue," Kazemian said, adding that the implementation will be completed within 10 days. As reported yesterday by BlockBeats, Frax Finance's core team is considering proposing a new plan aimed at sharing protocol revenue with its veFXS token holders. This move will mimic a similar proposal on decentralized exchange Uniswap last week.

detailed_analysis.title: FXS Price Surges Over 10% Following Frax Finance's Revenue Sharing Plan Announcement
detailed_analysis.body: Affected by the news of "Frax Finance plans to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders", FXS surged more than 10% in the short term. According to market data from OKX on February 26th, as reported by BlockBeats, FXS surged over 11% in a short period of time to a current price of $9.3 USD due to the news that Frax Finance plans to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Considers Revenue Sharing Proposal for veFXS Token Holders
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance is considering a new proposal to share protocol revenue with veFXS token holders, similar to a recent proposal on Uniswap. CEO Sam Kazemian revealed that this proposal aims to share a portion of the protocol's revenue with veFXS token holders, who are users that lock FXS tokens to receive veFXS, retaining governance and utility rights. These tokens can be staked on the Ethereum mainnet and Frax Finance's layer-2 network, Fraxtal. Despite the community voting to stop revenue sharing in 2022, Kazemian stated they are exploring the possibility of reopening revenue distribution to veFXS holders.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Considers Revenue Sharing with FXS Stakers, FXS Price Jumps 17%
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance's core team is considering a proposal to share protocol revenue with stakers of the FXS token, following a model similar to Uniswap's. This news has led to a 17% increase in the price of FXS. The proposal, still pending community approval, aims to distribute a portion of Frax Finance's growing annual revenues back to FXS stakers. The initiative mirrors a recent successful proposal by Uniswap that boosted UNI token prices by over 70%.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Considers Uniswap-Like Reward Mechanism for Token Stakers
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance is considering implementing a reward mechanism similar to Uniswap for its token stakers. The decision to adopt this mechanism will be left to the community's vote, as stated by Frax's CEO, Sam Kazemian, in an interview with CoinDesk.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Launches Ethereum Layer 2 Network Fraxtal
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance, a leading DeFi project, has announced the launch of its Ethereum Layer 2 network, Fraxtal. The network, which is an Ethereum compatible optimistic rollup developed using OP Stack, has become operational today on a restricted mainnet for select partner applications. Fraxtal is part of the Optimism's Superchain ecosystem alongside Coinbase-backed Base, with initial access limited to launch partners including Safe, Chainlink Oracles, and decentralized infrastructure providers such as Axelar and LayerZero bridges. It is anticipated that general users will soon gain access to the chain, which will serve as a platform for decentralized applications (DApps), focusing on decentralized finance. Frax, valued at over $1 billion, operates under the management of Frax Shares (FXS) tokens. An airdrop snapshot for holders of the voted FXS tokens will be available on March 6, offering Fraxtal (FXTL) points, though it's unclear if these points will be replaced with a separate token in the future.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Launches Modular Layer 2 Blockchain Fraxtal
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance has announced the launch of a modular Layer 2 blockchain called Fraxtal. BlockBeats news, on February 8th, the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance officially announced the launch of its modular Layer 2 blockchain Fraxtal. Fraxtal testnet and mainnet are now open to specific launch partners, and ordinary users will be able to connect to the chain in the coming days.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax V3 Introduces Frax Bond Module with Trustless Debt Repayment
detailed_analysis.body: Frax V3 has officially launched the Frax Bond (FXB) module. The development team has completed the design and deployment of all new functions for Frax V3. The FXB is uniquely priced in Frax stablecoin rather than USD, allowing for trustless debt repayment through FXB contracts. The initial release includes three FXBs with maturity dates set for June 30th, 2024, December 31st, 2024, and December 31st, 2026.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance to Launch Layer 2 Blockchain Fraxtal in February
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance, a stablecoin protocol, has announced plans to launch its Layer 2 blockchain, Fraxtal, in February. The founder, Sam Kazemian, revealed that the launch is scheduled for the first week of February, with Etherscan providing support for Fraxscan from day one. A significant number of projects are expected to debut following the release. Fraxtal aims to enhance Frax's product suite, which includes a fully collateralized algorithmic stablecoin, a lending platform, an automated market maker, an inflation-linked stablecoin (FPI), and the liquidity provider token FRXETH. The new blockchain will utilize rollup technology to execute transactions on the Ethereum mainnet, offering batch processing and data compression. FRXETH will serve as the power source for Layer 2 and will be used to pay gas fees on the blockchain.

detailed_analysis.title: Integration of Frax Finance with Axelar (AXL) and Centrifuge's RWA has been completed.
detailed_analysis.body:
BlockBeats reported on December 22nd that the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance has completed integration with off-chain asset tokenization pioneer Centrifuge through cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL). The Frax community voted to establish a $20 million debt ceiling for Anemoy LTF, which is a US financial fund registered on Centrifuge and regulated by the British Virgin Islands (BVI). 

Axelar (AXL) allows any on-chain protocol and liquidity to interoperate with Centrifuge's RWA (Real World Asset) issuance. Frax has approved Axelar as the cross-chain infrastructure, safely expanding Frax beyond its native bridge Frax Ferry. The "Centrifuge Everywhere" multi-chain strategy is supported by Axelar, bringing native Centrifuge RWA to Arbitrum, Base, Celo, and Ethereum.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance integrates cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL) and issues assets such
detailed_analysis.body:
BlockBeats news, on December 20th, Frax Finance, a hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol, announced that it has integrated with cross-chain infrastructure protocol Axelar Network (AXL) to issue assets such as FRAX and frxETH on multiple blockchain platforms including Osmosis, Mantle, Linea, Kujira, Manta Network, and Scroll. This move aims to enhance the coverage and interoperability of its assets, further expanding the ecosystem of Frax Finance.

Frax Finance recently launched an extensive real-world asset (RWA) strategy, with cross-chain expansion being a core part of it. Blockchain interoperability is seen as a key factor in the practicality of stablecoin and RWA applications. Frax chose Axelar Network as a partner based on its scalability, programmability, and security. Through this partnership, Frax aims to promote the generation, trading, and circulation of digital assets in multiple use cases, contributing to the development of a more interconnected decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax founder: FXS will be the gas token of Fraxchain, which can share network sorter revenue.
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on November 2nd that Sam Kazemian, founder of Frax Finance, announced on the official Telegram channel that Fraxchain will be a general-purpose Rollup instead of an application chain designed specifically for Frax Finance. Any type of application can be deployed on Fraxchain. FXS will be the gas token for Fraxchain, which can share network sorter revenue and be used for decentralized mechanism regulation of the sorter after future updates.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance Reports Domain Hijacking Incident
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance confirms the successful resolution of its domain name hijacking issue. There have been no instances of user funds being compromised.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance: The domain has been restored to normal and the reason for the incident will be announced
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on November 1st that Frax Finance announced on social media that Name.com has contacted and confirmed that frax.finance and frax.com domain names have been restored to the correct domain servers and configurations. They will explain the cause of the incident after conducting a comprehensive investigation tomorrow.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance DNS domain name was taken over by hackers.
detailed_analysis.body: Frax Finance DNS domain name was taken over by hackers. This is the third recent security incident in which a domain name has been taken over through social engineering. Frax Finance and its founder Sam Kazemian said users should not use the domain name until they get it back.…

detailed_analysis.title: PardShield: Frax Finance website DNS appears to have been hijacked.
detailed_analysis.body: According to PeckShield's monitoring data on November 1st, the DNS of the hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol Frax Finance's website was suspected to have been hijacked. As previously reported by BlockBeats, Frax Finance officials have advised against using the frax.finance and frax.com domains until further notice.

detailed_analysis.title: Frax Finance: Please refrain from using the frax.finance and frax.com domains until further notice.
detailed_analysis.body: BlockBeats reported on November 1st that Frax Finance, a hybrid algorithm stablecoin protocol, has officially stated that users should not use the domains frax.finance and frax.com until further notice. If any users know employees of the domain service provider Name.com, please contact Frax Finance.

It comes at a crucial time as bitcoin crosses the chasm between early adopters and mainstream users. The focus is on maintaining self-custodianship even as bitcoin becomes more complex and fees increase. Muun 2.0 is a complete rethinking of the wallet based on user feedback and promises an improved user experience.

detailed_analysis.title: Introducing the Umbrel App Store
detailed_analysis.body: Introducing the Umbrel App Store: A new era of self-hosted Bitcoin apps begins. Users can now run their own payment processor, set up multi-signature custody, run a blockchain explorer, chat over the Lightning Network, and more, all backed by their own Bitcoin and Lightning node. The Umbrel App Store offers one-click installation and a Tor hidden service for each app, ensuring privacy and security. Developers can also build and submit apps using the Umbrel App Framework. This marks a paradigm shift in computing and empowers users to take control of their data and transactions.

detailed_analysis.title: Introducing Bitcoin Zero [BTC0]
detailed_analysis.body: Bitcoin Zero (BTC0) is a new ERC-20 token that delivers Bitcoin with net-zero emissions. It combines a single Bitcoin with the retirement of 10 tonnes of CO2 from certified rainforest projects. BTC0 is available for trading on Uphold and aims to stimulate demand for voluntary carbon credits while allowing users to own Bitcoin. This breakthrough was made possible by the availability of Universal Carbon (UPCO2), the world's first tradable carbon token. BTC0 is part of the Universal Protocol Alliance's suite of stablecoin and crypto-commodity tokens.

detailed_analysis.title: 📬 DeFiprime #27 - November's Recap
detailed_analysis.body: New DeFi products and developments include PieDAO's DEFI++ index token, 1inch.exchange's v2 with optimizations, sOIL token representing Brent Crude Futures, StaFi's Eth2 staking liquidity solution, Vector's cross-chain routing network, Umbrella Protocol for risk management, Slingshot's DEX aggregator, and CRETH2 Eth2 derivatives token. Defiprime also lists new products and features interviews with DeFi projects. Noteworthy links include collaborations, investments, and announcements in the decentralized space. Stay updated by subscribing to Defiprime's new Twitter account.

detailed_analysis.title: Watching 👁️ ‘Global Security’ & Surveillance in France
detailed_analysis.body: The article discusses the need to radicalize the fight against surveillance and censorship, particularly in light of recent developments such as the passing of the "Global Security" law in France. It emphasizes the importance of protecting fundamental human rights and freedom of expression, and highlights the role of technology in providing tools for secure communication and information dissemination. The article calls for action and vigilance in the face of increasing threats to our rights.
